name: Recipe - Food - Nutrition
description:
The spoonacular Nutrition, Recipe, and Food API allows you to access over 365,000 recipes and 86,000 food products. Our food ontology and semantic recipe search engine makes it possible to search for recipes using natural language queries, such as "gluten free brownies without sugar" or "low fat vegan cupcakes." You can automatically calculate the nutritional information for any recipe, analyze recipe costs, visualize ingredient lists, find recipes for what's in your fridge, find recipes based on special diets, nutritional requirements, or favorite ingredients, classify recipes into types and cuisines, convert ingredient amounts, or even compute an entire meal plan. With our powerful API, you can create many kinds of food and especially nutrition apps.

Special diets/dietary requirements currently available include: vegan, vegetarian, pescetarian, gluten free, grain free, dairy free, high protein, low sodium, low carb, Paleo, Primal, ketogenic, FODMAP, and Whole 30. We will soon be adding Weight Watcher points, too.

api_methods.name: Create Recipe Card (Deprecated)
api_methods.description: Create a recipe card given a recipe.

parameters.name: backgroundImage
parameters.description: The background image ("none","background1", or "background2").

parameters.name: readyInMinutes
parameters.description: The number of minutes it takes to get the recipe on the table.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The title of the recipe.

parameters.name: image
parameters.description: The binary image of the recipe as jpg.

parameters.name: mask
parameters.description: The mask to put over the recipe image ("ellipseMask", "diamondMask", "diamondMask", "starMask", "heartMask", "potMask", "fishMask").

parameters.name: instructions
parameters.description: The instructions to make the recipe. One step per line.

parameters.name: ingredients
parameters.description: The ingredient list of the recipe, one ingredient per line.

parameters.name: servings
parameters.description: The number of servings that you can make from the ingredients.

parameters.name: fontColor
parameters.description: The font color on the recipe card as a hex-string.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: The source of the recipe.

parameters.name: author
parameters.description: The author of the recipe.

parameters.name: backgroundColor
parameters.description: The background color on the recipe card as a hex-string.

utterances.utterance: Create a recipe card for a 30-minute chicken stir fry with a star mask and a white background.

parameters.title: Chicken Stir Fry
parameters.instructions:
1. Heat oil in a pan.
2. Add chicken and stir fry until cooked.
3. Add vegetables and cook until tender.
parameters.ingredients:
1 chicken breast
1 cup broccoli
1 cup carrots

utterances.utterance: Make a recipe card for a 45-minute vegan lasagna with a heart mask and a light blue background.

parameters.title: Vegan Lasagna
parameters.instructions:
1. Layer lasagna sheets with vegan cheese and tomato sauce.
2. Bake at 180°C for 30 minutes.
parameters.ingredients:
1 pack lasagna sheets
2 cups vegan cheese
2 cups tomato sauce

utterances.utterance: Generate a recipe card for a 20-minute avocado toast with a diamond mask and a yellow font color.

parameters.title: Avocado Toast
parameters.instructions:
1. Toast the bread.
2. Mash avocado and spread on toast.
3. Add salt and pepper to taste.
parameters.ingredients:
2 slices of bread
1 avocado
Salt and pepper

utterances.utterance: Create a recipe card for a 60-minute beef stew with a pot mask and a dark green background.

parameters.title: Beef Stew
parameters.instructions:
1. Brown the beef in a pot.
2. Add vegetables and broth.
3. Simmer for 45 minutes.

utterances.utterance: Make a recipe card for a 15-minute fruit salad with a fish mask and a pink font color.

parameters.title: Fruit Salad
parameters.instructions:
1. Chop all fruits.
2. Mix in a bowl.
3. Serve chilled.

utterances.utterance: Generate a recipe card for a 40-minute vegetarian chili with an ellipse mask and a light gray background.

parameters.title: Vegetarian Chili
parameters.instructions:
1. Sauté onions and garlic.
2. Add beans and tomatoes.
3. Simmer for 30 minutes.
parameters.ingredients:
1 cup kidney beans
1 cup black beans
2 cups diced tomatoes

utterances.utterance: Create a recipe card for a 25-minute shrimp pasta with a star mask and a purple font color.

parameters.title: Shrimp Pasta
parameters.instructions:
1. Cook pasta according to package instructions.
2. Sauté shrimp in garlic and olive oil.
3. Combine and serve.

utterances.utterance: Make a recipe card for a 50-minute chocolate cake with a heart mask and a light pink background.

parameters.title: Chocolate Cake
parameters.instructions:
1. Mix dry ingredients.
2. Add wet ingredients and mix well.
3. Bake at 180°C for 40 minutes.
parameters.ingredients:
2 cups flour
1 cup sugar
1/2 cup cocoa powder

utterances.utterance: Generate a recipe card for a 35-minute chicken curry with a diamond mask and a light green background.

parameters.title: Chicken Curry
parameters.instructions:
1. Sauté onions and spices.
2. Add chicken and cook until done.
3. Add coconut milk and simmer.

utterances.utterance: Create a recipe card for a 10-minute smoothie with a pot mask and a light yellow background.

parameters.title: Smoothie
parameters.instructions:
1. Blend all ingredients until smooth.
2. Serve immediately.

api_methods.name: Recipe Nutrition Widget
api_methods.description:
Visualize a recipe's nutritional information as HTML including CSS. 

Full example code of how to work with widgets can be found in our [spoonacular-widget GitHub](https://github.com/ddsky/spoonacular-widgets).

parameters.name: servings
parameters.description: The number of servings.

parameters.name: ingredientList
parameters.description: The ingredient list of the recipe, one ingredient per line.

parameters.name: showBacklink
parameters.description: Whether to show a backlink to spoonacular.

parameters.name: defaultCss
parameters.description: Whether the default CSS should be added to the response.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: The input language, either "en" or "de".

utterances.utterance: Can you show me the nutritional information for a recipe with 4 servings and ingredients: 1 cup flour, 2 eggs, and 1 cup milk?
I need the nutrition details for a dish with 3 servings and these ingredients: 200g chicken, 1 onion, and 2 tomatoes. Also, include a backlink to spoonacular.
What’s the nutritional breakdown for a recipe with 2 servings and ingredients: 1 cup rice, 1 cup beans, and 1 tsp salt? Don’t add the default CSS.

parameters.ingredientList:
1 cup rice
1 cup beans
1 tsp salt

utterances.utterance: Show me the nutrition widget for a meal with 5 servings and ingredients: 300g beef, 2 carrots, and 1 potato. Use German as the language.
Can you generate the nutritional info for a recipe with 1 serving and ingredients: 1 banana, 1 tbsp peanut butter, and 1 slice bread? Include the backlink and default CSS.

parameters.ingredientList:
1 banana
1 tbsp peanut butter
1 slice bread

utterances.utterance: I’d like to see the nutrition details for a dish with 6 servings and ingredients: 500g pasta, 2 cups tomato sauce, and 1 cup cheese. Don’t show the backlink.

parameters.ingredientList:
500g pasta
2 cups tomato sauce
1 cup cheese

utterances.utterance: What’s the nutritional content for a recipe with 2 servings and ingredients: 1 cup oats, 1 cup milk, and 1 tbsp honey? Use English as the language.

parameters.ingredientList:
1 cup oats
1 cup milk
1 tbsp honey

utterances.utterance: Can you display the nutrition widget for a meal with 3 servings and ingredients: 200g salmon, 1 lemon, and 1 tbsp olive oil? Don’t include the default CSS.
Show me the nutritional information for a recipe with 4 servings and ingredients: 1 cup quinoa, 1 avocado, and 1 cup spinach. Include the backlink.
I need the nutrition breakdown for a dish with 2 servings and ingredients: 1 cup lentils, 1 onion, and 1 tsp cumin. Use German as the language and don’t show the backlink.

api_methods.name: Detect Food in Text
api_methods.description: Detect ingredients and dishes in texts.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The text in which food items such as dish names and ingredients should be detected in.
parameters.default: I like to eat delicious tacos. Only cheeseburger with cheddar are better than that. But then again, pizza with pepperoni, mushrooms, and tomatoes is so good!

utterances.utterance: Can you identify the food items in this sentence: 'For dinner, I had a bowl of spaghetti with meatballs and a side of garlic bread.'

parameters.text: For dinner, I had a bowl of spaghetti with meatballs and a side of garlic bread.

utterances.utterance: What ingredients are mentioned in 'I made a smoothie with bananas, strawberries, and almond milk this morning.'?

parameters.text: I made a smoothie with bananas, strawberries, and almond milk this morning.

utterances.utterance: Detect the dishes in 'Last night, we enjoyed grilled salmon with a side of roasted vegetables.'

parameters.text: Last night, we enjoyed grilled salmon with a side of roasted vegetables.

utterances.utterance: Find the food items in 'I’m craving a slice of pepperoni pizza and a Caesar salad.'

parameters.text: I’m craving a slice of pepperoni pizza and a Caesar salad.

utterances.utterance: Identify the ingredients in 'I need to buy eggs, milk, and bread for breakfast tomorrow.'

parameters.text: I need to buy eggs, milk, and bread for breakfast tomorrow.

utterances.utterance: What dishes are mentioned in 'We’re planning to have sushi and miso soup for lunch.'?

parameters.text: We’re planning to have sushi and miso soup for lunch.

utterances.utterance: Can you detect the food items in 'I had a delicious bowl of chicken noodle soup and a grilled cheese sandwich.'?

parameters.text: I had a delicious bowl of chicken noodle soup and a grilled cheese sandwich.

utterances.utterance: Find the ingredients in 'I’m making a salad with lettuce, tomatoes, cucumbers, and feta cheese.'

parameters.text: I’m making a salad with lettuce, tomatoes, cucumbers, and feta cheese.

utterances.utterance: What food items are in 'For dessert, I’d like a slice of chocolate cake and a scoop of vanilla ice cream.'?

parameters.text: For dessert, I’d like a slice of chocolate cake and a scoop of vanilla ice cream.

utterances.utterance: Detect the dishes in 'We’re having tacos with beef, lettuce, and cheese for dinner tonight.'

parameters.text: We’re having tacos with beef, lettuce, and cheese for dinner tonight.

api_methods.name: Compute Shopping List
api_methods.description: Compute a shopping list from a set of simple foods. This endpoint does not require usernames.

What should I buy for a paleo meal plan for two people?

I’m planning a vegetarian week. What groceries should I get?
Help me create a shopping list for a high-protein diet.
What ingredients do I need for a week of Whole 30 meals?
Can you generate a shopping list for a pescetarian diet?
I need a shopping list for a low-sodium meal plan.

api_methods.name: Generate Shopping List

parameters.name: hash

parameters.name: start-date

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The username.

I’d like to get a shopping list for dsky from June 1st to June 7th.
Prepare a shopping list for the user dsky for the week of June 1st to June 7th.
Can you generate a shopping list for dsky covering the dates June 1st to June 7th?
I need a shopping list for dsky from June 1st through June 7th.
Please generate a shopping list for dsky for the time frame of June 1st to June 7th.

api_methods.name: Analyze Recipe
api_methods.description: This endpoint allows you to send raw recipe information, such as title, servings, and ingredients, to then see what we compute (badges, diets, nutrition, and more). This is useful if you have your own recipe data and want to enrich it with our semantic analysis.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: The input language, either \\\"en\\\" or \\\"de\\\".

utterances.utterance: Can you analyze a recipe for gluten-free chocolate cake?
What nutritional information can you provide for a vegan lasagna recipe?
I have a recipe for low-carb pancakes. Can you analyze it?
Could you compute the nutritional details for a high-protein chicken salad?
Analyze a recipe for dairy-free banana bread and tell me the nutritional content.
What diets does a paleo-friendly beef stew recipe fit into?
Can you analyze a recipe for ketogenic avocado brownies?
I need the nutritional breakdown for a low-sodium vegetable soup recipe.
Analyze a recipe for whole 30 compliant chili and provide the dietary information.
What badges would a grain-free zucchini muffin recipe earn?

api_methods.name: Analyze Recipe Instructions
api_methods.description: Extract ingredients and equipment from the recipe instruction steps.

parameters.name: instructions
parameters.description: The instructions text.
parameters.default: Put the garlic in a pan and then add the onion.

utterances.utterance: Can you analyze the steps for making a chocolate cake?

parameters.instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Mix the flour, sugar, and cocoa powder in a bowl. Add eggs, milk, and oil, then mix until smooth. Pour the batter into a greased pan and bake for 30 minutes.

utterances.utterance: What ingredients and equipment are needed for this pasta recipe?

parameters.instructions: Boil water in a large pot. Add salt and pasta, cook until al dente. In a pan, heat olive oil and sauté garlic. Add tomatoes and basil, then mix with the pasta.

utterances.utterance: Extract the ingredients and tools from these pancake instructions.

parameters.instructions: Mix flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a bowl. In another bowl, whisk milk, egg, and melted butter. Combine the mixtures and cook on a hot griddle.

utterances.utterance: Analyze the steps for preparing a vegan smoothie.

parameters.instructions: Blend bananas, spinach, almond milk, and chia seeds in a blender until smooth. Serve immediately.

utterances.utterance: What do I need to make this chicken curry?

parameters.instructions: Heat oil in a pan, add onions and garlic. Add chicken pieces and cook until browned. Stir in curry powder, coconut milk, and simmer for 20 minutes.

utterances.utterance: Can you break down the steps for baking cookies?

parameters.instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F. Cream butter and sugar, then add eggs and vanilla. Mix in flour, baking soda, and chocolate chips. Drop spoonfuls onto a baking sheet and bake for 10 minutes.

utterances.utterance: Extract the ingredients and equipment from this soup recipe.

parameters.instructions: Sauté onions and carrots in a pot. Add vegetable broth, potatoes, and beans. Simmer for 30 minutes, then blend until smooth.

utterances.utterance: Analyze the instructions for making a fruit salad.

parameters.instructions: Chop apples, bananas, and strawberries into bite-sized pieces. Mix in a bowl with yogurt and honey.

utterances.utterance: What ingredients and tools are required for this stir-fry?

parameters.instructions: Heat oil in a wok, add sliced chicken and cook until done. Add vegetables and stir-fry for 5 minutes. Mix in soy sauce and serve.

utterances.utterance: Can you analyze the steps for preparing a grilled cheese sandwich?

parameters.instructions: Butter two slices of bread. Place cheese between the slices and grill in a pan until golden brown on both sides.

api_methods.name: Connect User
api_methods.description:
In order to call user-specific endpoints, you need to connect your app's users to spoonacular users.

Just call this endpoint with your user's information and you will get back a username and hash that you must save on your side. In future requests that you make on this user's behalf you simply pass their username and hash alongside your API key.

utterances.utterance: Can you connect my app user to spoonacular?
I need to link my app's user to spoonacular for personalized recipes.
How do I connect my user to spoonacular to access their services?
Please set up a connection between my app user and spoonacular.
I want to connect my user to spoonacular to get personalized nutrition information.
Could you help me link my app's user to spoonacular for recipe recommendations?
I need to connect my user to spoonacular to access their food ontology.
How can I connect my app user to spoonacular for dietary-specific recipes?
Please connect my user to spoonacular so they can get meal plans.
I’d like to link my app user to spoonacular to analyze recipe costs.
